characters.name: ALL OF THE LIGHTS TURN ON.

scenes.heading: INT. BATHROOM - MORNING
scenes.actionPreview: BRYNN practices smiling in the mirror. She’s not particularly convincing. Adds a wave for good measure. Trying to look casual and pleasant- But just looking nervous and uncomfortable. Tries again before frowning and fixing her hair, still in her nightgown.

scenes.heading: INT. BEDROOM - MORNING
scenes.actionPreview: Brynn stares at two dress options. She made them both. After some debate, she picks one. Then changes her mind and goes with the other.

scenes.heading: INT. THE FAMILY ROOM - MORNING
scenes.actionPreview: It’s clear that Brynn lives here alone. In her early twenties. She heads downstairs into her immaculately designed home. It’s decorated cutely with Halloween trinkets. She passes a LeMax halloween village of different spooky buildings which is just a liiiiittle too big. She turns their lights on and

scenes.heading: INT. BASEMENT - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: This is where she works. Reams of fabric. Drawers of buttons. Sewing machine. A list of her Etsy orders. Brynn does a little more work on a dress. The work makes her happy. 2. She finishes off a dress and carefully folds it. Wraps a bow around it. Like it was the most special thing in the world. Han

scenes.heading: EXT. FRONT YARD - DAY

dialogues.text: can’t see her when he pulls up to her mailbox at the end of her driveway.

scenes.actionPreview: Brynn writes a letter under a tree, lounging against the trunk. Dear Maude, Her home is very well kept. Surrounded by thick woods. There are garden boxes of vegetables by a small shed. Brynn looks up from her letter when she hears something. Turns towards the street. The sound of a car. She smiles.

scenes.heading: INT. THE FAMILY ROOM - MOMENTS LATER
scenes.actionPreview: She carefully cuts open the box with scissors, finally revealing- An ungodly amount of bubble wrap inside. She laughs victoriously at her flawless defeat of the mailman. She carefully reaches inside and pulls out- A small LeMax box of a She grins, carefully opens it so as not to ruin the packaging-

scenes.heading: INT. CLOSET - MOMENTS LATER
scenes.actionPreview: Brynn carefully places the empty box on a row of similar boxes. Rows of Christmas Village buildings wait their turn.

scenes.heading: EXT. FRONT YARD - DAY

dialogues.text: in her grass and part of her flowerbed.

scenes.actionPreview: The sun is beginning to set. Brynn sets her packages in her small car. She moves over to a flower bed and carefully cuts a few stems- Pauses when she sees a Brynn groans, looking closer. 3. 4. Not burned necessarily. Just like everything dried up in a perfect 8 foot wide circle. She sighs and waters

scenes.heading: INT. CAR - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: She listens to oldies while she drives. Strangely full of anxiety. She looks into her rear-view mirror and practices that smile again.

scenes.heading: EXT. POST OFFICE - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: She drives up to a mailbox- But before she lowers the window- She puts on a hat and sunglasses to obscure her face. Then she lowers the window and quickly drops off her mail. Before zipping away quickly.

scenes.heading: EXT. PARKING LOT - SUNSET
scenes.actionPreview: Brynn gets out of her car. The parking lot a little too full for her liking. She carries the flowers with her.

scenes.heading: EXT. GRAVEYARD - SUNSET
scenes.actionPreview: Brynn replaces the not-too-dead flowers in a vase by the headstone that reads Sarah Adams, Wife to Hugh, Mother to Brynn. She spends some time with her mother, before feeling that awful sensation that she’s being watched. She slowly turns and sees a group of women across the graveyard at a funeral-

scenes.heading: EXT. PARKING LOT - SUNSET
scenes.actionPreview: When Brynn returns to her car, she sees a small She doesn’t remember that being there before. Looks back towards the funeral, unsure of how to react- Before getting back into her car and driving away.

scenes.heading: INT. RECORD PLAYER - EVENING
scenes.actionPreview: Brynn carefully selects a record from her shelf of oldies. She puts one on. The speakers crackle and the jazzy waltz begins. Brynn happily sways in her dress, all the anxiety from leaving the house gone as she dances-

scenes.heading: INT. KITCHEN - EVENING

dialogues.text: steps from a vintage dance book.

scenes.actionPreview: Into her kitchen. Pulls the cork off a bottle. Pours herself some red. Opens her laptop. And begins cooking a dinner for one. The ‘30s music carries her through as she- Sautés vegetables. Broils chicken. Practices Drinks more red (but never irresponsibly so). 5. 6. Chats on iChat with someone named

scenes.heading: INT. FREEZER - NIGHT

dialogues.text: outside that house on the fridge door. Brynn and her mom.

scenes.actionPreview: She pulls out some cookie dough ice cream. Photo of a

scenes.heading: INT. THE FAMILY ROOM - NIGHT
scenes.actionPreview: She sits down on her couch. Clicks on TCM. Watches a black and white romance. She loves it with all of her heart.

scenes.heading: INT. KITCHEN - NIGHT
scenes.actionPreview: Polishes off the red. Does all of her dishes. Washed and dried. Bottle into the recycling. Ties up the trash.

scenes.heading: EXT. BACK OF THE HOUSE - NIGHT
scenes.actionPreview: She puts her bags neatly in their respective bins. Looks up at her house in the dark. Can faintly see remnants of painted over graffiti on her wall. Unclear what it says. 6. 7. Brynn frowns. Problems for another a day.

scenes.heading: INT. KITCHEN - NIGHT
scenes.actionPreview: Brynn wishes LeMaxter85 sweet dreams and closes her laptop. Finishes the letter she was writing. Seals it in an envelope. Takes it with her upstairs. The computer never travels upstairs with her.

scenes.heading: INT. UPSTAIRS HALLWAY - NIGHT
scenes.actionPreview: Brynn carries the letter into a room. She’s only in there for a few seconds. And when she returns to the hallway, there is no letter in her hand.

scenes.heading: INT. BATHROOM - NIGHT
scenes.actionPreview: She brushes her teeth. Brushes her long hair. Puts on face cream.

scenes.heading: INT. BEDROOM - NIGHT
scenes.actionPreview: Breeze flutters into her room from the window. Curtains billow. The drone of crickets. She reads late into the night. No cellphone or iPad or TV in here. Just the soft glow of her bedside reading lamp. An owl hoots outside. She raises her eyes and smiles. Places her bookmark and sets the book down.

scenes.heading: INT. BRYNN’S BEDROOM - 3:27 A.M.
characters: ALL OF THE LIGHTS TURN ON.

on her dresser and decides it’s her best option.

scenes.actionPreview: Brynn is fast asleep. Breeze still ruffling the curtains. Crickets still performing. Until- A large gust of wind comes through the room. Curtains flow. Brynn stirs but doesn’t wake. Fast asleep when the crickets completely stop. Then- The sound of birds quickly flying from their nests. Too many bird

scenes.heading: EXT. UPSTAIRS HALLWAY - CONTINUOUS
scenes.actionPreview: She walks slowly- Slowly- Across her wooden floors. Towards the stairs at the end of the hall. Passing closed doors on either side. She reaches the top of the stairs and looks below. Nothing. She takes a cautious step down. Nothing. And then a second step down when- A FIGURE HURRIES ACROSS THE ROOM.

scenes.heading: INT. UNDER BRYNN’S BED - NIGHT
scenes.actionPreview: Brynn squeezes herself under- Reaches and pulls her blanket down to obstruct her view as- Her bedroom door is pushed open. But there’s no footsteps yet. She turns her head to face the door- Tears in her eyes and- Sees the No denying what she’s seeing now. It doesn’t move for a long time. A long time

scenes.heading: INT. BRYNN’S BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS
scenes.actionPreview: She slowly lifts her head- Peering above the bed- And sees nothing. Just the breeze through her curtains. She swallows. Takes a deep breath and- Rushes to the window- Where she quickly and quietly pushes it closed- Locking it. She dodges out of view, expecting some kind of reaction but- There is not

scenes.heading: INT. UPSTAIRS HALLWAY - NIGHT
scenes.actionPreview: Brynn walks with the curling iron raised over her head like a baseball bat. Shuffling down the hall- Towards the stairs- She reaches the top of the stairs again- Sees the front door open down below. Leans forward to see if the coast is clear- Seems to be- So she takes a few sharp breaths and-

scenes.heading: INT. THE FAMILY ROOM - NIGHT

dialogues.text: standing at the top of the stairs.

scenes.actionPreview: She pushes it closed and locks both locks. Backing away from it- Expecting something to happen- Some reaction- But there is nothing. She keeps backing away when- Again, The TV and the record player. Horrifically loud. She SCREAMS! This time they don’t turn off. She runs over to the TV and rips the p

scenes.heading: INT. KITCHEN - CONTINUOUS

dialogues.text: with long boney fingers reaches out from the darkness.
into the door and throwing the Alien back-

scenes.actionPreview: Where she presses her body flush against the wall. Waiting to hear anything but- Nothing. She looks ahead- The glass doors to her backyard. The trees of the woods swaying ominously. Full of shadow and darkness. She tears her eyes away and looks towards the ceiling. The phone cord above her. She slid

scenes.heading: INT. THE FAMILY ROOM - CONTINUOUS

dialogues.text: but with way too much power-
Brynn doesn’t move for a second-

scenes.actionPreview: She heads for the front door- Gasping as she goes when- All the lights, the tv, the record player- All Bulbs She yelps at the raining glass- 21. 22. Pixels in the TV burn through- Speakers on the record player blow out- But Brynn keeps running towards that door- But as she reaches for it- The front

scenes.heading: INT. THE FAMILY ROOM - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: Brynn hasn’t moved in hours. She shivers from cold. Still in shock. Traumatized. The Alien still very dead in the middle of her living room. Brynn blinks and finally realizes how cold she is. Sniffles. Dried blood on her face and in her hair. She looks down towards her feet and sees- A shard of She

scenes.heading: INT. KITCHEN - MOMENTS LATER
scenes.actionPreview: The phone on the wall. Brynn stares at it nervously. Glances around. Fridge door open- No light on inside. Spilled drinks and food on the floor. Eyes back to the corpse. Still dead. Eyes back to the phone. A nervous step forward. She reaches out her hand. Deep breath and- Grabs the phone off the rec

scenes.heading: INT. LAPTOP - CONTINUOUS
scenes.actionPreview: She throws open her laptop. Nothing. Jams the power key. Nothing. Plugs it in. No green light. Nonononono-

scenes.heading: INT. CLOSET - CONTINUOUS
scenes.actionPreview: She pulls the light string- Nothing. Looks down. Sees bulb glass. Ughhhh- 27. 28.

scenes.heading: INT. LAUNDRY ROOM - CONTINUOUS
scenes.actionPreview: Hobbles into the laundry room- Tries the light switches. Nothing. No power to the washer or dryer.

scenes.heading: INT. DOWNSTAIRS BATHROOM - CONTINUOUS
scenes.actionPreview: No power in the tiny bathroom-

scenes.heading: INT. BASEMENT - CONTINUOUS
scenes.actionPreview: Opens the door to the basement and flicks the lights. Nothing either. Hurries downstairs. Roots through a drawer- Pulls out an old Dead. Glass on the floor. Sewing machine fried. Brynn groans and runs back upstairs-

scenes.heading: INT. UPSTAIRS HALLWAY - CONTINUOUS
scenes.actionPreview: She scampers into that room she left the letter in. No luck in there either as she comes back out. Tip-toeing around glass as best she can as she hurries into-

scenes.heading: INT. BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS
scenes.actionPreview: Nothing in the bedroom either. She opens a dresser drawer and pulls out- An old 29. All the polaroids discharged overnight. There are no photos left. Angry, she tosses it roughly back in the drawer- Slamming it shut- She leaves- Then comes back and looks at her sheets, still jumbled from when the Al

scenes.heading: INT. TRASH BAG - CONTINUOUS
scenes.actionPreview: She puts them all in a trash bag. But doesn’t throw them out. She ties the bag neatly and sets it in the corner of her room. Evidence.

scenes.heading: INT. MASTER BATHROOM - CONTINUOUS
scenes.actionPreview: No power in the upstairs bathroom. She catches her reflection in the mirror. She looks like a mess. Quickly moves away. More important things to deal with first.

scenes.heading: INT. THE FAMILY ROOM - CONTINUOUS
scenes.actionPreview: This room is a disaster. She stumbles around- Trying not to look at the corpse- Trying to figure out what might have power- Has a thought and runs out the front space where the door used to be to- 29. 30.

scenes.heading: EXT. BACK OF THE HOUSE - CONTINUOUS
scenes.actionPreview: Where the fusebox is. She opens it up. Tries turning it off and on. Makes no difference. She groans and whines and then- Has a terrible thought.

scenes.heading: INT. KITCHEN - CONTINUOUS
scenes.actionPreview: Scrambles through some of the mess to find- Her

scenes.heading: EXT. DRIVEWAY - CONTINUOUS
scenes.actionPreview: Hobbles with her sore bare foot to the car as quick as she can. Hits the unlock button but- Nothing happens. Hits it over and over and over- Nothing. Desperate and frustrated she unlocks it with the key like a goddamn peasant- And dives inside.

scenes.heading: INT. CAR - CONTINUOUS

dialogues.text: She tries again and again until-

scenes.actionPreview: Sits in the front seat. Deep breath and prayers and- Turns the ignition. She breaks down- 30. 31. Slamming her fists on the steering wheel and screaming. When she’s done- She doesn’t feel better. Her eyes drift to the back of the car- And her tiny shed behind the car.

scenes.heading: INT. SHED - CONTINUOUS
scenes.actionPreview: She pulls out her Surveys what’s inside. Lots of gardening equipment. Shears. Soil. Shovel. A lawn mower.

scenes.heading: EXT. FRONT YARD - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: She grabs her bike- Hopping on- And then as soon as her bare foot hits the pedal- Quickly stumbling off. Wincing. Rubbing her poor bare foot. She catches her disheveled reflection in the car window. Pats down her hair. Knows exactly how it will go for her if anyone in town sees her looking like this

scenes.heading: INT. SHOWER - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: Still in her nightgown, she scrubs her foot clean. It hurts. She scrubs her head clean. 31. 32. It hurts. Big ol’ cut and bruise where the door hit her. She pokes it curiously. There will be more.

scenes.heading: INT. BEDROOM CLOSET - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: She opens her closet, wrapped in a robe, and pulls out options of what to wear. It fills her with a She bites her lip and stares at three options displayed on her bed while she quickly combs her hair. She chooses one and puts it on. She applies Neosporin and bandages to her foot and face. Carefully

scenes.heading: INT. THE FAMILY ROOM - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: She stares at the corpse. Then out the front door shaped hole at her bike. Then back at the corpse. There are flies buzzing around it. Scrunches up her face. Well it’s not going with her on that bike so she- 32. 33.

scenes.heading: INT. LINEN CLOSET - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: Finds the blanket she likes the least.

scenes.heading: INT. THE FAMILY ROOM - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: Lays it over the Alien. Then sprays a ton of air freshener around it. Heads for the door-hole and- Stops. Realizes that anything could get in. Think think think- She moves to her couch- Pushes it as hard as she can- Grunts and sweats as- It finally budges and- She blocks part of the door with it.

scenes.heading: EXT. FRONT YARD - CONTINUOUS
scenes.actionPreview: She crawls over it to land outside. Reaches back in and props up some cushions to block the entrance a little bit. Surveys her work. It’ll do. Then- A Her eyes dart there in fear- But sees nothing. Maybe it was just a bird. She stares intensely into the distance- Nothing now but shadows and the crea

scenes.heading: EXT. ROAD - MOMENTS LATER
scenes.actionPreview: Brynn zips down the road on her bike. Long hair in the wind. Determined like she’s never been before.

scenes.heading: EXT. MAIN STREET - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: She bikes down a quaint, boring American main street. A couple people notice her go past- But even though she clearly notices- She doesn’t stop.

scenes.heading: EXT. THE POLICE STATION - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: She locks her bicycle at a rack to the side of the station. She stands there, trying to psych herself up. Shaking. Scared as hell. But she summons every bit of courage she has- Lowers her head and- Walks inside.

scenes.heading: INT. THE POLICE STATION - CONTINUOUS
scenes.actionPreview: She opens the door and- Comes face to face with 35. They stare at her- Startled. Literally no one in the world they’d rather see less than her- And literally no one Brynn would be more scared to see right now than them. The rest of the station hushes up to watch the unfortunate encounter. Brynn look

scenes.heading: EXT. THE POLICE STATION - MOMENTS LATER
scenes.actionPreview: Brynn stumbles out of the station- Wiping her face- Humiliated and mortified- Hurries to her bike- Kneels to unlock it and- Breaks down into She can’t help it. It all just pours out of her. She tries to make herself stop. Balling up her fists- Hitting her leg. Wipes her face again. Tries taking deep

scenes.heading: INT. BUS STATION - DAY

dialogues.text: to Tulsa clenched in her hand.

scenes.actionPreview: Brynn walks with a Keeps her head down. Just trying to get out.

scenes.heading: INT. STORE AT THE BUS STATION - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: She quickly dashes into a convenience store- Grabs a baseball hat- Sunglasses- 37. 38. Someone is watching her. She crosses an aisle- Grabs a sweatshirt- Toothbrush- Toothpaste- A watch- A man at the end of the aisle. Gum- Chips- Snacks- Whatever it takes to get to tomorrow- There is something diffe

scenes.heading: INT. BUS - DAY

dialogues.text: sitting a few rows behind her.
Everyone in the bus staring at Brynn-

scenes.actionPreview: Brynn sits against the window on the sparsely populated bus. Foot tapping anxiously. No one in the seat beside her. Just her bags of supplies. Hat down. Sunglasses on. That Out of focus but clearly staring at her when- The bus lurches forward. And the journey begins. Brynn lets out a small, victorio

scenes.heading: EXT. STREET - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: The bus makes an unplanned stop and- Brynn High-tailing it as fast as she can away. And after a long, drawn out moment- The He watches her go. Then turns and walks the other direction- Mumbling to himself.

scenes.heading: EXT. TOWN - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: Out of breath and sweaty- 42. 43. Brynn finally slows down. Hands on her knees. Deep breaths. She looks back- No sign of the man. Well that’s something. But now there’s even less of a scrap of a plan- When something catches her eye to the right- She looks and- Sees a And the Flipping the open sign-

The alarm is deafening. She covers her ears- Eyes dart

scenes.heading: EXT. THE ROAD - EVENING
scenes.actionPreview: Brynn runs faster than she has ever run in her life. The clouds follow steadily. There’s only one place left for Brynn to go-

scenes.heading: EXT. THE ROAD - EVENING
scenes.actionPreview: And that’s her From the road, she stares up at her house like it’s the most haunted place in the world. She looks at her watch. 6:36. There is no sun left in the sky. She taps her watch a few times, wishing it was earlier. And that she had more time. But she doesn’t. So she moves with the weight of

scenes.heading: EXT. FRONT YARD - EVENING
scenes.actionPreview: She slows down as she approaches her house- Craning her neck forward nervously to see if the couch blockade is still at her door... It is. She exhales. Small blessings.

scenes.heading: INT. THE FAMILY ROOM - CONTINUOUS
scenes.actionPreview: She pushes the cushions out of the way and- The 49. Yugh. She covers her mouth and sees- The Alien under the blanket still. But even more flies. It’s... souring. Brynn almost throws up until- There’s another rumble of strange thunder outside. And she snaps to. There’s too much work to be done. And n

scenes.heading: EXT. SHED - EVENING
scenes.actionPreview: Dumps out the contents of her shed. Lawnmower. Leaf blower. Generator. Ladder. Hammer. Taps her foot while staring at them. Looks back at her dead car. 49. 50. That could work. So she begins to unscrew the cap on her lawnmower.

scenes.heading: EXT. CAR - EVENING
scenes.actionPreview: She pops up from behind the car, having done something underneath. Wipes her hands on her pants and gets in- She makes sure all the car doors are unlocked. Then, to be extra safe, makes sure all the doors are just barely left open.

scenes.heading: EXT. BACK OF THE HOUSE - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: She rips out all of the Just drops them on the ground. Leaves- But returns quickly- Gathering them up. Feeling bad about littering.

scenes.heading: EXT. GARBAGE CANS - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: Drops them in the garbage. Closes the lid- Sees that little bit of graffiti still peaking through the layers of paint she covered it up with in the past. Another frown. She looks down at the She darts away, motivation renewed. Still so much to do.

scenes.heading: INT. BEDROOM - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: Wraps a scarf around her nose and mouth. 50. 51.

scenes.heading: INT. THE FAMILY ROOM - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: A scented candle is lit. Then a second. And a third. Broken glass and broken village all over the floor. Fucking front door on the floor. Brynn tries her best to ignore the Alien for now. Moves to pick up the door- It breaks apart as soon as she lifts it into two splintered pieces. Fucking useless.

scenes.heading: INT. VARIOUS ROOMS - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: She leaves chunks of door in various places of various rooms.

scenes.actionPreview: Looks through the contents of her kitchen cupboards. Knives. Pots. Pans. An old lighter. She flicks it. Flame. Good. Pockets it.

scenes.heading: INT. KITCHEN - DAY

dialogues.text: that silently illuminate through the windows of the rooms she passes.

scenes.heading: INT. THE FAMILY ROOM - CONTINUOUS

scenes.heading: INT. UPSTAIRS HALLWAY - CONTINUOUS
scenes.actionPreview: She hears them behind her- Her bedroom at the end of the hall. Not sure if she can make it in time. So she turns left. Into The Room.

scenes.heading: INT. THE ROOM - NIGHT
scenes.actionPreview: It is quiet in here. Quieter than the rest of the house. Darker too. Shades and curtains drawn. Until the door is pushed open- Jussssst a little. The silhouette of a Grey peering through. Black eyes glisten. Pushes the door open more and- As light comes in the room- It sees what’s actually in here.

scenes.heading: INT. UPSTAIRS HALLWAY - NIGHT
scenes.actionPreview: Brynn Smashing into the hall. She hits the floor. Coughs. Holy shit that was awful. She grabs her ribs. Something’s probably broken. Something must be broken. But she remains alive. For now. She looks into the room and sees The Alien standing there. 70. 71. Just... watching her. As the door slowly c

scenes.heading: INT. HER BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS
scenes.actionPreview: Can hear the shower running in her bathroom still. Reaches for the bed to lean o- THWUMMMPPPP! Brynn is CAUGHT IN THE LIGHT- Blasting through her bedroom window- Paralyzed by it when- She trembles in place- Can’t even move her mouth when- That awful droning the only thing she hears. She can move her

scenes.heading: INT. BEDROOM - MORNING

dialogues.text: when she wakes up in her bed.

scenes.actionPreview: Brynn Hair a mess from the nightmare. The... nightmare? It takes her a few seconds to calm down. There’s no one else in her room. It’s morning. She’s in her bed. In her nightgown. Birds chirp outside. She grasps at her back- It’s dry. No cuts. She jumps out of bed- Still alarmed- But starting to slo

scenes.heading: INT. UPSTAIRS HALLWAY - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: Her house just the way it always was. 73. 74.

scenes.heading: INT. THE FAMILY ROOM - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: Her LeMax village just the way it always was. She looks at it for a moment before- She hears that sound again- Humming. Coming from the kitchen. Nervously, she walks towards the room. Bare feet on the floor as-

scenes.heading: INT. KITCHEN - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: Brynn sees Cooking. Humming. She wears a dress. The one Brynn was making. She turns and smiles at Brynn. Brynn chokes out a joyous, shocked cry at seeing her. At seeing her face. and hurries to Brynn- Wrapping her in a hug. Brynn doesn’t hug back for a beat- Eyes wide with surprised tears. Until fin

scenes.heading: INT. THE FAMILY ROOM - NIGHT
scenes.actionPreview: Brynn comes to- Lying on the floor of the family room. Right where the Alien corpse was. She spits up fluid as her hand comes out of her mouth- That blood-clot thing in her hand. It screeches in panic at Brynn- Before she slams her hand down on the ground- Bringing her other hand over to it- Squishi

scenes.heading: INT. HALLWAY - CONTINUOUS

dialogues.text: the chunk down violently on its head-
looks like Brynn if you weren’t wearing glasses.
her box cutter into its neck.

scenes.actionPreview: A GREY IS RIGHT THERE! Before it can react- She It tumbles to the ground- Tries to get up but- Before it can do anything- Brynn is wailing on it- Bashing it again and again- Roaring. It reaches out its hand- Trying to do something to save its life- The fire from the stove ERUPTS- Sending the boiling

scenes.heading: EXT. ROAD - NIGHT
scenes.actionPreview: Grunting with determination- Brynn grips her stomach and shuffles down the road. Fire in the background until- THWUMMMPPPP! The light blasts down from above the house- Snuffing out all of the fire and then- It’s gone. Brynn doesn’t stop or look back. THWUMMMPPPP! Not even when the light hits farther

scenes.heading: EXT. THE WOODS - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: Two twelve year old girls in skirts go into the woods. One of them is Brynn. One of them is Maude.

scenes.heading: EXT. THE WOODS - NIGHT
scenes.actionPreview: Brynn leaves the woods. There is blood on her clothes.

scenes.heading: INT. BRYNN’S HOUSE - NIGHT

dialogues.text: reacts in alarm when she sees her daughter.

scenes.actionPreview: Brynn’s When she sees the blood.

scenes.heading: EXT. BRYNN’S HOUSE - NIGHT
scenes.actionPreview: Brynn’s mother cries alone. Brynn watches from the backseat of a squad car. The blue flashing lights are almost pretty.

scenes.heading: INT. COURT ROOM - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: Mrs. Collins and the Police Chief cry in relief as Brynn is sentenced. She looks at them as she’s escorted away.

scenes.heading: INT. JUVENILE DETENTION - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: Brynn moves in. Brynn eats meals. Brynn’s mom visits. Brynn sleeps. Brynn reads books.

scenes.heading: INT. THERAPY - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: The faces of smiling therapists. The faces of the people that helped her understand. 83. 84. Eventually Brynn breaks down into tears. Processes. Progress.

scenes.heading: INT. BUNK - NIGHT
scenes.actionPreview: Brynn writes a letter. Dear Maude,

scenes.heading: EXT. FUNERAL - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: Brynn gets to attend her mother’s funeral. A guard is nearby. All eyes on Brynn. Her eyes on the casket. A headstone that says Mother of Brynn.

scenes.heading: EXT. PARKING LOT - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: Brynn is released. Older and healthier and wiser and stronger. There’s no one waiting for her. EXT./INT. BRYNN’S HOUSE - DAY Brynn gets home. The house in a state of disrepair. Boxes of backed-up mail. All of the letters to Maude, mailed here.

scenes.heading: EXT. TOWN - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: Brynn walks down Main Street. Everyone watches her. Everyone hates her. Her hands shake. 84. 85.

scenes.heading: INT. BRYNN’S HOUSE - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: Brynn cleans her house. Makes it her own. Makes it perfect.

scenes.heading: EXT. BRYNN’S HOUSE - NIGHT
scenes.actionPreview: Brynn scrubs “Murderer” off the side of her house.

scenes.heading: INT. BRYNN’S HOUSE - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: Brynn gets her first LeMax house. Sets it up proudly.

scenes.heading: INT. BRYNN’S HOUSE - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: The LeMax village grows. And grows.

scenes.heading: INT. THE ROOM - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: The collection of letters grows. And grows.

scenes.heading: INT. THE FAMILY ROOM - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: Brynn sets the fateful LeMax building down. You know the one. She smiles.

scenes.heading: EXT. ROAD - NIGHT
scenes.actionPreview: Brynn’s eyes snap back to focus- As the Grey before her- Lowers its hand. Brynn not growling anymore. Just long- Deep- Breaths. As the two regard each other. Some kind of clarity between them. And then- 85. 86. The light from above disappears- And Brynn falls to the ground. Ooomf. She stays there, f

scenes.heading: EXT. RECORD PLAYER - EVENING

dialogues.text: As if they were all getting used to their new bodies. 88.
is waiting in front of her-

scenes.actionPreview: Two gloved hands place a record on the player. Brings down the needle. The audio crackles and then- The Brynn moves away. Looking classy as hell in a winter coat and a dress. She smiles to herself, swaying with the music, revealing that- She’s in the middle of the road. On Christmas lights twinkling
